description:
Due to this change:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/124384/

The tests are using this URL:

self.wh.path = "ws://127.0.0.1/?token=123-456-789"

And "ws" is an undefined scheme.  Due to a python bug:

http://bugs.python.org/issue9374

The query string isn't parsed for an undefined scheme.  For example:

Python 2.7.3 (default, Sep 26 2013, 20:08:41) 
[GCC 4.6.3] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> import urlparse
>>> path = "ws://127.0.0.1/?token=123-456-789"
>>> query = urlparse.urlparse(path).query
>>> query
''

There is an older bug 1202149 for the same problem in Nova.
title: NovaProxyRequestHandlerBaseTestCase fails on python < 2.7.4 due to urlparse bug

comments.content:
Due to this change:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/124384/

The tests are using this URL:

self.wh.path = "ws://127.0.0.1/?token=123-456-789"

And "ws" is an undefined scheme.  Due to a python bug:

http://bugs.python.org/issue9374

The query string isn't parsed for an undefined scheme.  For example:

Python 2.7.3 (default, Sep 26 2013, 20:08:41) 
[GCC 4.6.3] on linux2
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> 
>>> 
>>> 
>>> import urlparse
>>> path = "ws://127.0.0.1/?token=123-456-789"
>>> query = urlparse.urlparse(path).query
>>> query
''

There is an older bug 1202149 for the same problem in Nova.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
I think I'll just update the tests to use http:// rather than ws:// since that's what the docs are also using:

http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide-cloud/content/getting-started-with-vnc-proxy.html

"A user connects to the API and gets an access_url such as, http://ip:port/?token=xyz."

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/125398
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=542d885874c063d6be0754393fcf70e00be7435a
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 542d885874c063d6be0754393fcf70e00be7435a
Author: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <email address hidden>
Date:   Wed Oct 1 12:04:18 2014 -0400

    console: make unsupported ws scheme in python < 2.7.4
    
    Due to a bug in python < 2.7.4, urlparse won't parse a query string
    in a URL where the scheme is not recognized:
    
    http://bugs.python.org/issue9374
    
    Commit 1dda5ef75a5c141c316639716820b0c37773a9e3 added some tests for
    websocketproxy that uses urlparse to get a token but these don't work
    on python < 2.7.4 since the scheme in the tests is "ws://".
    
    In the actual code, raise an exception if python < 2.7.4 and an
    unsupported URL scheme is used.
    
    DocImpact: The "getting-started-with-vnc-proxy" page in the
    "admin-guide-cloud" docs should be updated with a note that the web
    proxy console URLs do not support the websocket protocol scheme (ws://)
    on python versions less than 2.7.4.
    
    Change-Id: Ib6e0fc4e50c1ea144a9c538099e23597d66b429b
    Closes-Bug: #1376078
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
This fix is problemlic: As self.path will never contain the schema information whatever the proxy url is configured with https or http. The self.request_version will contain the schema like information such as 'HTTP/1.1'
parse.scheme will always being empty whatever proxy url https or http.

if parse.scheme not in ('http', 'https'):	48
			# From a bug in urlparse in Python < 2.7.4 we cannot support 	49
			# special schemes (cf: http://bugs.python.org/issue9374) 	50
			if sys.version_info < (2, 7, 4):	51
			raise exception.NovaException(	52
			_("We do not support scheme '%s' under Python < 2.7.4, "

The check above will cause any version which below 2.7.4 python novnc function broken.
